required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tear Film Stability of DAILIES® AquaComfort Plus® Contact Lenses vs. MyDay® Daily Disposable Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Pre-Lens Tear Film Stability With Daily Disposable Contact Lenses Using Ring Mire Projection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate tear film stability of DAILIES® AquaComfort Plus® (DACP) compared to MyDay® after 12 hours of lens wear.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator)

primary_outcome.description: Time from first eye opening to 15% distortion of the ring mires projected onto the tear film. The right eye will be used for the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Speed of Tear Film Break Up at 15 Seconds After 12 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: The slope of the regression line (distorted areas vs. time) will be calculated. The right eye will be used for the analysis.

arm_group.description: Nelfilcon A contact lenses worn first, with stenfilcon A contact lenses worn second. Each product worn in both eyes for 1 day, up to 12 hours.
Stenfilcon A contact lenses worn first, with nelfilcon A contact lenses worn second. Each product worn in both eyes for 1 day, up to 12 hours.

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations
